official-title.#text: To direct the Federal Trade Commission to promulgate regulations prohibiting mobile applications from accessing certain content and functions of a mobile device when such applications are not actively in use unless the user is provided with a disclosure of such access and grants affirmative express consent to such access.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Securing Our Nation’s Application Privacy Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Securing Our Nation’s Application Privacy Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Access by mobile applications to certain device content and functions

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall promulgate regulations in accordance with

text.#text: Not later than 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: while the application is not actively in use, unless—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Securing Our Nation’s Application Privacy Act of 2014/s:2/ss:b

text.#text: any person who develops, sells or offers for sale, or otherwise makes available to consumers a mobile application to ensure that the application does not access any content or functions described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Securing Our Nation’s Application Privacy Act of 2014/s:2/ss:b/p:2

text.#text: the application triggers the disclosure and consent functions of the mobile platform or operating system described in

any person who develops, sells or offers for sale, or otherwise makes available to consumers a mobile platform or operating system to ensure that the mobile platform or operating system—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , provides the user of the device with a disclosure of such access and the opportunity to grant affirmative express consent to such access or to deny such access; and
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Securing Our Nation’s Application Privacy Act of 2014/s:2/ss:b

text.#text: immediately before any mobile application that is installed on the mobile device and that is not actively in use accesses any content or functions described in
prevents the application from engaging in such access unless the user of the device grants such affirmative express consent.
The content and functions described in this subsection are the following:
Information about the geographic location of the device.
Contact information of individuals stored on the device.
Photographs, video recordings, or audio recordings stored on the device.
Events or notations stored in a calendar application (or an application with calendar functions) on the device.
A camera of the device or any information obtained from such a camera.
A microphone of the device or any information obtained from such a microphone.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Securing Our Nation’s Application Privacy Act of 2014/s:2/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: considers necessary to protect the privacy of users of mobile devices.

text.#text: In this Act:

quote.#tail: means, with respect to a mobile application, that—

text.#text: The term
the application is operating in accordance with the terms of service provided by the developer of the application to the user of the mobile device; and

the user of the mobile device is interacting with the application or the application is otherwise operating in a manner such that a user of ordinary technical expertise and experience would consider the application to be active, open, or running.

quote.#tail: means a software program that runs on the mobile platform or operating system of a mobile device.

text.#text: The term

quote.#tail: means a smartphone, tablet computer, or similar portable computing device that transmits data over a wireless connection.

text.#text: The term

quote.#tail: means the software that enables the basic functionality of a mobile device and the installation and use of mobile applications on the device.
